poem:
**Guardian Headlines**

In the quiet of morning,  
the pages rustle, revealing  
a prince in pursuit of whispers,  
seeking truth in lines of ink.  
Phone calls, shadowed voices,  
a dance of perjury and paper.  
The detective sun rises,  
warming hope as the city unfolds  
its layered arms of newsprint.  
Another day, another story.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Police request transcripts from Prince Harry’s case against owner of the Sun The Met police have requested transcripts of the pre-trial hearings in Prince Harry’s phone-hacking case against Rupert Murdoch’s newspaper empire, the Guardian can reveal, as fresh calls were made for a new criminal investigation. The development will raise the hopes among press intrusion campaigners of a potential new investigation into allegations of “perjury and cover-ups” made against News Group Newspapers (NGN), the owner". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
